hook.text: Chlamydia is the most commonly reported bacterial STI in the world, infecting millions each year.

buildup.text: The bacterium Chlamydia trachomatis infects the genital tract and can also affect the throat and eyes.

discovery.text: Most infected people show no symptoms, which is why it spreads so easily through populations.

twist.text: Untreated chlamydia can cause pelvic inflammatory disease in women and infertility in both sexes.

climax.text: A simple antibiotic course cures chlamydia completely. Early detection makes treatment straightforward.

punchline.text: Easy to catch, easy to miss, easy to cure.

quiz.question: What makes chlamydia spread so easily?
options: Most infected people show no symptoms
